intro: Amsinckia macrosepala, commonly known as the giant bonnet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Amsinckia macrosepala is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
